result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian A Simo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 12/04/15 plea/sentencing hearing.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Brian A Simo in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended information filed. Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #1 of the Amended information. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #1 on Amended information. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Harris makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. Defendant may be returned forthwith.The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT#1:

IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

___ 60 DAYS HUBER (CREDIT - 0 days) ***CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE***

COSTS:  $243.00 + $200.00 DNA surcharge - WAIVED

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,  immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
